intro: Perrierangraecum triquetrum, commonly known as the three-angled sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or brown in color. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in wet, marshy environments. Perrierangraecum triquetrum is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its unique appearance and adaptability.
